definition: the return of a prodigal son (idiom)
wave/breaker/unrestrained/dissipated/to stroll/to ramble
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
pinyin: lang4 zi3 hui2 tou2 jin1 bu4 huan4

sentences.english: Our congregation has welcomed home many prodigals, all struggling to become spiritual adults.
sentences.chinese: 我们的教会曾欢迎不少在灵里挣扎成长的浪子回头。

sentences.english: We could say that he has turned his life around.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以说他已经浪子回头了。

sentences.english: They welcomed the prodigal son home with open arms.
sentences.chinese: 他们张开双臂来欢迎浪子回头。

sentences.english: We felt this would be useful in making this final attempt to connect with some of the dark brothers, this change.
sentences.chinese: 我们再做最后的尝试想要让某些黑暗人士浪子回头。

sentences.english: He also taught us the example of the Father in the Prodigal Son.
sentences.chinese: 他亦利用浪子回头比喻中父亲的榜样来训导我们。

sentences.english: So how to make Baidu again new collect the station of this return to the fold?
sentences.chinese: 那么如何让百度再重新收录这个浪子回头的站呢？

sentences.english: The prodigal son is too late.
The story of the Prodigal Son is a very good parable.
sentences.chinese: 浪子回头的故事是一个很好的比喻。

definition: a prodigal son returned home is worth more than gold
pinyin: lang4 zi3 hui2 tou2 jin1 bu4 huan4

definition: to get back on the right path/to mend one's ways
lit. to wash one's heart and renew one's face (idiom); to repent sincerely and mend one's mistaken ways/to turn over a new leaf
to mend one's ways (idiom)/to turn over a new leaf
completely correcting one's former misdeeds (idiom); to repent past mistakes and turn over a new leaf/a reformed character
to repent
to change one's mind (idiom)
loafer/wastrel/prodigal son
to reform and start afresh (idiom); to turn over a new leaf
(of a slave or servant) to be given one's freedom/(of a prostitute) to marry and leave one's trade
to start a new life/to make a fresh start
to see the error of one's ways/to make a clean break with one's past
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
a shattered mirror put back together (idiom)/(of marriage) to pick up the pieces and start anew/for a separated couple to reconcile and reunite
lit. a dog can't stop himself from eating shit (idiom)/fig. bad habits are hard to change
pinyin: gou3 gai3 bu4 liao3 chi1 shi3

definition: to win success and recognition (idiom)
